title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected in the report design, but it is not being rejected correctly.
OB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', the system is not rejecting it.
EB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', the system should reject it and display an error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a 'DateTime' type report parameter.
4. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
5. Verify that the system does not reject the invalid date string and does not display an error message.
